On Apr 17, 2009, at 5:33 PM, Kris Zyp wrote:

> Certainly one of the key differences between JSON and XML is that in
> XML elements are simply named, but they don't define any relationship
> between child and parent. In JSON, it is exactly the opposite,
> property names are defining relationships between values rather than
> naming values. This is exactly why determining link relationships from
> structure is inappropriate for XML and appropriate for JSON.

By the way, XLink (http://www.w3.org/TR/xlink/) tried exactly that for  
XML. However, AFAIK, it is not widely adopted.

Subbu
